author: pietjepuk
content:
It's probably not much different from lowering the 12.5% per block rate, i.e. it becomes slower respond and therefore we end up with more doubly full blocks (and more priority fee needed to compensate). Not really better from a UX perspective is my expectation.

For the base fee to jump from 80 to 100 we need at least 2 full blocks (~28 seconds). In case the blocks are doubly full with the current system, not much will change with knowing the base fee 3-4 blocks ahead. Those blocks will be doubly full as well, and we have a first-price auction with the priority fee.

If the blocks that take the base fee from 80 to 100 are not doubly full under the current situation (say 3 _almost_ full blocks, ~40 seconds), then I think it's more likely that those 3-4 blocks in your hypothetical system will be doubly full (because more demand at lower gas price). Definitely not better UX.

Either way, I think there are changes to the fee market planned (maybe the Shanghai fork in ~1 year). I'm not sure they'll help on this front. Time sensitive transactions under a fluctuating fee market means you need to be fast if you have a constraint on the gas price you can afford I'm afraid.
